function.name: view_website_source
function.description: Fetches and returns the full, JavaScript-rendered HTML source code from a given URL using a headless Chrome browser. Use this to inspect the structure and content of a webpage.

url.description: The full URL of the website to get the source code from (e.g., 'https://www.example.com').

function.name: visit_url
function.description: Visits a given URL using a headless Chrome browser to simulate a user visit and trigger on-load events. It returns a success or failure message. Use this when an action requires simply loading a page.

url.description: The full URL of the website to visit.

function.name: click_element
function.description: Finds and clicks an element (like a button or link) on a webpage. The element is located using its HTML tag, CSS classes, and the visible text it contains.

url.description: The URL of the page where the element to be clicked exists.

tag_name.description: The HTML tag of the element (e.g., 'button', 'a', 'div').

class_names.description: A space-separated string of the CSS classes on the element (e.g., 'btn btn-primary start-button').

text_content.description: The visible text within the element that helps to identify it.

function.name: input_text
function.description: Finds an input field on a webpage and types text into it. The field is located using its HTML tag, CSS classes, and placeholder text.

url.description: The URL of the page where the input field exists.

tag_name.description: The HTML tag of the element (e.g., 'input', 'textarea').

class_names.description: A space-separated string of the CSS classes on the element.

placeholder_text.description: The placeholder text of the input field.

text_to_input.description: The text that will be typed into the field.
